H0.text: Removing the old theory from historical records is what the scientific community should do when new research uncovers information proving that data from the old theory is partially incorrect.

H1.text: Changing the research notes in the original theory is what the scientific community should do when new research proves that data from an old theory is partially incorrect.

H2.text: Using the new information to update the old theory is what the scientific community should do when new research proves that data from an old theory is partially incorrect.

H3.text: Ban the public from discussing the old theory is what the scientific community should do when new research proves that data from an old theory is partially incorrect.

A4.text: modifications to the previous theory are sufficient to explain the new evidence

A5.text: the strength of a theory relates to how long it has persisted without major alteration to its core principles
